citations.narrative:
The licensee did not have the acquisition record for the two capybara that were acquired last month. They were not listed
on records of animals on hand, nor did she list the date of death for the one that passed away approximately a week ago.
These records need to be maintained in an accurate and timely manner to promote good recordkeeping practices.

The fence line on the front side of the kangaroo yard needs to be addressed. The fence at the bottom is no longer staked
to the ground which is causing wire to curve upwards into the enclosure, creating gaps between the fence and ground.
There are also some wires that have broken and are sharp at the base of the fence line. This fencing needs to be
maintained in good repair for the safety of the kangaroos.

The interior ceiling of the bird trailer housing the budgies needs to be addressed. The budgies have been pecking and
peeling off the cardboard material of the ceiling creating gaps between the metal roof and interior ceiling. This ceiling
needs to be fixed to prevent the birds from having access to the metal roof and to keep the trailer in good repair for the
safety of the budgies.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee did not have the acquisition record for the two capybara that were acquired last month. They were not listed 
on records of animals on hand, nor did she list the date of death for the one that passed away approximately a week ago. 
These records need to be maintained in an accurate and timely manner to promote good recordkeeping practices. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
The fence line on the front side of the kangaroo yard needs to be addressed. The fence at the bottom is no longer staked 
to the ground which is causing wire to curve upwards into the enclosure, creating gaps between the fence and ground. 
There are also some wires that have broken and are sharp at the base of the fence line. This fencing needs to be 
maintained in good repair for the safety of the kangaroos. 
3.150(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
The interior ceiling of the bird trailer housing the budgies needs to be addressed. The budgies have been pecking and 
peeling off the cardboard material of the ceiling creating gaps between the metal roof and interior ceiling. This ceiling 
needs to be fixed to prevent the birds from having access to the metal roof and to keep the trailer in good repair for the 
safety of the budgies. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
